snippet: The Federal Reserve was close to starting to ease its stimulus campaign, the minutes of its September meeting show.
abstract: Minutes of September Federal Reserve meeting show it was close to starting to ease its economic stimulus campaign before it voted 9-to-1 to keep adding $85 billion a month to its holdings of Treasury securities and mortgage-backed securities; mounting fiscal crisis in Washington suggests that some months will pass before Fed will have cause to reconsider, due to fears for economy.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve was close to starting to ease its stimulus campaign, the minutes of its September meeting show.

headline.main: Fears for Economy Kept Stimulus Intact
headline.print_headline: Fears for Economy Kept Stimulus Intact
